admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund: TF031364-CROATIA - PROPOSED HEALTH INSURANCE,TF025139-PHRD-HEALTH SYSTEM PROJECT,TF027640-PHRD-SUBERNAREKHA IRRIGATION (BIHAR)

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, and its sustainability is highly likely.
            Lessons drawn from the project indicate that, given the
            experience gained by the Bank so far, from health projects
            in transition economies, there was the need to ensure
            investment stability in the sector, through a rational
            health financing policy, and commitment to fiscal
            discipline, as well as, the need to adapt project design to
            the often, limited managerial capacity encountered in those
            countries. Therefore, a health insurance administration
            component was incorporated to consolidate achievements, and
            keep the project simple, with lesser complex components.
            However, the initial project expectations, for preparation
            of bidding documents, or terms of reference for technical
            assistance, were overly ambitious, given the fact that the
            Bank assumed a faster initiation, and the Government was
            seemingly unaware of the extent of procedural, and
            administrative requirements. Hence, a realistic focus on
            both parts, could have contributed to accurate
            implementation targets, since, additionally, the amount of
            work the project entailed, was under-estimated, for although
            originally, policy guidance, and management were to be
            supported by the Government, essential activities were made
            the responsibility of one project implementation officer,
            whose extremely competent work, eased success, but,
            additional staff would have been beneficial.
